unnormalised: ## New Wheels on the Road: What's Hot in the Automotive Scene!
normalised: ## New Wheels on the Road: What's Hot in the Automotive Scene!

unnormalised: Namaste, petrolheads and auto enthusiasts! The Indian automotive market is buzzing louder than a Mumbai local during rush hour, with a flurry of new vehicle launches. Let's take a quick peek at what’s making headlines.
normalised: Namaste, petrolheads and auto enthusiasts! The Indian automotive market is buzzing louder than a Mumbai local during rush hour, with a flurry of new vehicle launches. Let's take a quick peek at what’s making headlines.

unnormalised: First up, remember that sleek SUV from the Auto Expo in Delhi? Well, Mahindra's finally unleashed the "Agni" (because everything needs a fiery name, right?), and it's already turning heads. They’re promising a mileage of 22 kmpl, which, if true, is a godsend considering the rising fuel prices! Prices start at a cool Rs. 12 Lakhs.
normalised: First up, remember that sleek S U V from the Auto Expo in Delhi? Well, Mahindra's finally unleashed the "Agni" (because everything needs a fiery name, right?), and it's already turning heads. They’re promising a mileage of twenty two kilometer per liter, which, if true, is a godsend considering the rising fuel prices! Prices start at a cool rupee twelve lakhs.

unnormalised: Then there's Tata Motors, consistently churning out impressive stuff. They just launched the facelifted 'Indica 2.0' with, apparently, 'futuristic' features. I'll believe it when I see it, but hey, competition is good! Some sources tell us it will come with a 1.5L engine.
normalised: Then there's Tata Motors, consistently churning out impressive stuff. They just launched the facelifted 'Indica two point zero' with, apparently, 'futuristic' features. I'll believe it when I see it, but hey, competition is good! Some sources tell us it will come with a one point five liter engine.

unnormalised: Even Maruti Suzuki isn't sitting still. Rumor has it they're prepping a souped-up version of the Brezza, with more power and hopefully, less of that boring beige interior. I saw some leaked photos, it looks amazing!
normalised: Even Maruti Suzuki isn't sitting still. Rumor has it they're prepping a souped-up version of the Brezza, with more power and hopefully, less of that boring beige interior. I saw some leaked photos, it looks amazing!

unnormalised: Speaking of interiors, haven't car designers ever watched "3 Idiots"? “Pursue excellence, and success will follow, not the other way around,” Rancho would say. Apply that to dashboard design, please!
normalised: Speaking of interiors, haven't car designers ever watched "Three Idiots"? “Pursue excellence, and success will follow, not the other way around,” Rancho would say. Apply that to dashboard design, please!

unnormalised: Finally, a shout-out to the IIT-Madras team working on electric vehicle battery technology. These guys are the real MVPs, paving the way for a sustainable future!
normalised: Finally, a shout-out to the I I T-Madras team working on electric vehicle battery technology. These guys are the real M V Ps, paving the way for a sustainable future!

unnormalised: So, folks, keep your eyes peeled and your wallets ready. The Indian automotive landscape is about to get a whole lot more interesting! What launches are you most excited about? Let me know in the comments!
normalised: So, folks, keep your eyes peeled and your wallets ready. The Indian automotive landscape is about to get a whole lot more interesting! What launches are you most excited about? Let me know in the comments!
